item.title: Open-world survival shooter Deadside now available for PS5, Xbox Series
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/open-world-survival-shooter-deadside-now-available-for-ps5-xbox-series

  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Previously released for PC.

Publisher tinyBuild and developer Bad Pixel have released open-world survival third-person shooter Deadside for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series for $24.99, the companies announced.

Deadside first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on April 14, 2020, followed by a full release on December 5, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Deadside blends your favorite survival shooter elements in a fast-paced open world where progression is swift and loot is plenty. Obtain valuable gear, and store it in a safe zone. Or build your own fortress in the wild, securing it with turrets, making it cozy while boosting your stats, and use it to store your vehicles and loot. Traverse the world by foot, car, motorcycle, boat, or a Quick Travel metro system. Make friends or enemies. Join Player-Versus-Player or Player-Versus-Environment servers. Explore the vast open world filled with challenging events, and raid your enemies.

Player-Versus-Player, Player-Versus-Environment, Raiding

We have three types of servers in Deadside 1.0: Player-Versus-Player, Player-Versus-Environment, and Player-Versus-Player No Raids.

Note on all three types of servers your player disappears when offline with all loot on your body

  • Player-Versus-Player servers provide an intense hardcore experience where players can engage in fights, and can raid each other’s bases with no limits.
  • Player-Versus-Environment servers are a more chill experience where you can interact with other players, and can’t fight each other or raid/steal each other’s bases. We recommend this mode to learn the game’s mechanics.
  • Player-Versus-Player No Raids are a blend of both, where you can fight each other while being unable to raid bases.

Vehicles and Fast Travel

Nobody likes running forever in open world survival games. Deadside has boats, motorcycles, cars, and a Fast Travel System to easily get around the map. Secure your vehicles with codelocks and use them for storage.

Base Building and Comfort System

Build a secluded shack or a secured fortress. We made it easy to build with an intuitive tool, and added plenty of comfort items which are useful for gameplay boosts. Secure your base with passive defenses such as turrets and traps. Store your vehicles, and keep your hard earned loot safe from raiders.

The World of Deadside

Explore the forests, rivers, and settlements of this post-soviet apocalypse. You can build anywhere outside of settlements. Challenging NPCs patrol the map, and your progression is solely decided by your own skill. There are no levels or bars. Your level is your skill and the equipment you acquire.

Weapons, Combat System, Missions

It’s all about the ballistics and variety of weapons. Choose from 32 firearms, and modify them with scopes, expanded mags, flashlights, silencers and other modules. Feeling tactical? Setup tripwire traps, respawn bags, use smoke grenades for cover. The combat system is designed to be hardcore. Combine this with an intuitive missions system with clearly marked objectives on the map and you have the perfect hardcore survival shooter.

Watch a new trailer below.

PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series Launch Trailer

item.title: Fable delayed to 2026
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/fable-delayed-to-2026

  • PC
  • Xbox Series

No longer due out in 2025.

Publisher Xbox Game Studios and developers Playground Games and Eidos Montreal have delayed Fable from its previously planned 2025 release window to 2026.

“I just want to start with, [we’re] really excited about progress, really excited where Playground are,” head of Xbox Game Studios Craig Duncan said in the latest Official Xbox Podcast. “We previously announced the date for Fable as 2025—we are actually going to give Fable more time and it’s going to ship in 2026 now. While I know that’s not maybe the news people want to hear, what I want to assure people of is that it’s definitely worth the wait.”

Duncan continued, “I have unequivocal confidence in the Playground team. If you think about their history and legacy for Forza Horizon, the last two games—critically acclaimed, award-winning, beautiful, played great. And just what they’re bringing to Fable as a franchise, just think of the visuals of what you expect of Playground Games, plus amazing gameplay, British humor, Playground’s version of Albion—so inspired by what’s gone before with the franchise, but their take. And quite frankly, the most beautifully realized version of Albion you’ve ever seen. So really excited about the plans and really excited about the future and I want the community to understand that we do these things for the best of the games, and the teams, and ultimately that results in the best games, or the best game for the community.”

Fable will be available for Xbox Series and PC.

Watch some new footage below (from 15:56 to 17:02).

New Footage
